detailed_description: Split Raster is a Python package designed to break down large remote sensing images into smaller, manageable tiles. It is specifically tailored for preparing datasets for deep learning and computer vision tasks in geospatial analysis.

name: pyeogpr
one_line_profile: Vegetation trait retrieval using Gaussian Process Regression
detailed_description: A Python package for retrieving vegetation traits from remote sensing data using Gaussian Process Regression (GPR). It supports workflows in Google Earth Engine and openEO.

name: TiTiler CMR
one_line_profile: TiTiler extension for NASA CMR queries
detailed_description: An extension for TiTiler that enables dynamic tiling directly from NASA's Common Metadata Repository (CMR) queries, facilitating access to NASA Earth Science data.

name: TiTiler MultiDim
one_line_profile: TiTiler application for NetCDF and Zarr datasets
detailed_description: A TiTiler extension designed for serving multidimensional geospatial data formats like NetCDF and Zarr, commonly used in meteorology and oceanography.

name: TiTiler MVT
one_line_profile: TiTiler extension for creating Mapbox Vector Tiles from COGs
detailed_description: An extension for TiTiler that dynamically creates Mapbox Vector Tiles (MVT) from Cloud Optimized GeoTIFFs, enabling efficient vector-based visualization of raster data.

name: TiTiler STAC API
one_line_profile: TiTiler extension for connecting to STAC APIs
detailed_description: An extension that connects TiTiler to SpatioTemporal Asset Catalog (STAC) APIs, allowing for dynamic tiling of assets indexed in STAC catalogs.

name: JupyterGIS TiTiler
one_line_profile: TiTiler integration for JupyterGIS
detailed_description: A bridge tool that integrates TiTiler's dynamic tiling capabilities into JupyterGIS, enabling interactive geospatial visualization and analysis within Jupyter environments.

name: geotrellis-contrib
one_line_profile: Community-contributed extensions and add-ons for the GeoTrellis geospatial processing engine
detailed_description: A collection of additional functionalities and experimental features for GeoTrellis that are not yet part of the core library, extending its capabilities for geospatial data processing.

name: geotrellis-ec2-cluster
one_line_profile: Deployment scripts for setting up GeoTrellis Spark clusters on AWS EC2
detailed_description: A set of Python scripts and utilities designed to automate the deployment and configuration of GeoTrellis-enabled Spark clusters on Amazon EC2 for large-scale geospatial data processing.

name: geotrellis-netcdf
one_line_profile: NetCDF data reader and processor for GeoTrellis/Spark
detailed_description: A library for reading and processing NetCDF (Network Common Data Form) files within the GeoTrellis and Spark ecosystem, facilitating the handling of multidimensional scientific data.

name: geotrellis-pointcloud
one_line_profile: Library for processing point cloud data (LiDAR) on Spark with GeoTrellis
detailed_description: Extends GeoTrellis to support the ingestion, processing, and analysis of large-scale point cloud data (e.g., LiDAR) using Apache Spark.

name: geotrellis-server
one_line_profile: Framework for building geospatial raster processing and display services
detailed_description: A set of components and tools for building high-performance web services that serve and process geospatial raster data, supporting standards like WMS/WMTS and dynamic rendering.

name: geotrellis-transit
one_line_profile: Library for generating travelsheds and accessibility maps from OSM and GTFS data
detailed_description: Provides tools to calculate travel time polygons (travelsheds) and accessibility metrics by integrating OpenStreetMap (OSM) road networks and GTFS public transit schedules.

name: maml
one_line_profile: Map Algebra Modeling Language for defining raster operations
detailed_description: A domain-specific language (DSL) and library for defining and executing map algebra operations on raster data, used within the GeoTrellis ecosystem for declarative geospatial modeling.

name: python-geotrellis
one_line_profile: Python bindings and utilities for the GeoTrellis engine
detailed_description: Provides Python interfaces to GeoTrellis functionality, allowing Python users to interact with GeoTrellis raster processing capabilities, often used in PySpark environments.

name: vectorpipe
one_line_profile: Pipeline for converting vector data to VectorTiles using GeoTrellis
detailed_description: A tool and library for processing large-scale vector data (e.g., OSM) and converting it into VectorTiles for web mapping, leveraging GeoTrellis for distributed processing.

name: pystackreg
one_line_profile: Python library for automatic image alignment and registration
detailed_description: A Python extension for the automatic alignment (registration) of a source image or a stack of images to a target image, useful in microscopy and remote sensing for stabilizing image series.

name: InstaGeo-E2E-Geospatial-ML
one_line_profile: End-to-end geospatial machine learning pipeline for Earth Observation data
detailed_description: A Python package designed to streamline the geospatial machine learning workflow, specifically handling multispectral Earth Observation data like NASA HLS and ESA Sentinel-2 for analysis tasks.

name: geopyspark
one_line_profile: Python bindings for GeoTrellis enabling geospatial processing in PySpark
detailed_description: A Python library that provides bindings to the GeoTrellis framework, allowing users to perform distributed geospatial data processing and analysis using PySpark.

name: geotrellis
one_line_profile: High-performance geographic data processing engine for Scala/Spark
detailed_description: A geographic data processing engine for high-performance applications, providing types and operations for working with raster and vector data in a distributed computing environment (Apache Spark).

name: rasterframes
one_line_profile: Geospatial raster support for Spark DataFrames
detailed_description: A library that adds geospatial raster support to Spark DataFrames, allowing users to process and analyze Earth observation data using standard Spark SQL and DataFrame APIs.

name: gis-mcp
one_line_profile: Model Context Protocol server connecting LLMs to GIS operations
detailed_description: A server implementation of the Model Context Protocol (MCP) that acts as a bridge between Large Language Models (LLMs) and GIS libraries, enabling AI assistants to execute geospatial operations and transformations.

name: segment-geospatial
one_line_profile: Segment Anything Model (SAM) for geospatial data
detailed_description: A Python package that adapts the Segment Anything Model (SAM) for geospatial data analysis. It enables users to segment satellite imagery and aerial photos with minimal prompting, facilitating rapid feature extraction and land cover mapping.

name: Raster Foundry
one_line_profile: Platform for finding, combining, and analyzing earth imagery
detailed_description: Raster Foundry is a web application and platform designed for processing and analyzing Earth observation data. It allows users to search for satellite imagery, combine different raster sources, and perform geospatial analysis within a unified interface.

name: pystac
one_line_profile: Python library for working with SpatioTemporal Asset Catalog (STAC)
detailed_description: PySTAC is a core library for working with the SpatioTemporal Asset Catalog (STAC) specification. It allows developers to create, read, and manipulate STAC catalogs, collections, and items, facilitating the organization and discovery of geospatial data.

name: pystac-client
one_line_profile: Python client for searching and accessing STAC APIs
detailed_description: A Python client designed to interact with STAC APIs. It enables users to search for geospatial assets based on spatial, temporal, and property filters, and is essential for data discovery pipelines in Earth science.

name: titiler-pgstac
one_line_profile: Dynamic tile server connecting TiTiler with PgSTAC
detailed_description: A TiTiler extension that connects to a PgSTAC database backend to serve dynamic map tiles. It enables high-performance visualization of large-scale STAC collections stored in PostGIS.

name: xpystac
one_line_profile: Extension for xarray to work with pystac objects
detailed_description: A library that bridges PySTAC and Xarray, allowing users to open STAC items and collections directly as Xarray datasets. This facilitates the analysis of multidimensional geospatial data cubes described by STAC metadata.

name: gfw_forest_loss_geotrellis
one_line_profile: Distributed analysis pipeline for global tree cover loss using Geotrellis and Spark
detailed_description: A Scala-based application developed by the World Resources Institute (WRI) for analyzing global forest loss. It utilizes Apache Spark and Geotrellis to process large-scale raster data, enabling the calculation of tree cover loss metrics over vast geographical areas.

name: ACCESS-OM2
one_line_profile: Global coupled ocean-sea ice model configuration and code
detailed_description: ACCESS-OM2 is a global coupled ocean-sea ice model that combines the MOM5.1 ocean model and the CICE5.1.2 sea ice model, coupled via OASIS3-MCT. It is designed for climate research and simulation.

name: LBLRTM
one_line_profile: Line-By-Line Radiative Transfer Model
detailed_description: LBLRTM is an accurate and efficient line-by-line radiative transfer model derived from the FASCODE algorithm. It is used for calculating spectral radiance and transmittance in the atmosphere.

name: monoRTM
one_line_profile: Monochromatic Radiative Transfer Model
detailed_description: monoRTM is a radiative transfer model designed to process a small number of monochromatic frequencies, suitable for microwave regions and laser applications, utilizing the same physics as LBLRTM.

name: CRITERIA-3D
one_line_profile: Three-dimensional agro-hydrological model
detailed_description: CRITERIA-3D is a three-dimensional agro-hydrological model for small catchments, simulating water balance, nitrogen flow, and heat transport in soil and vegetation systems.

name: F0AM
one_line_profile: Framework for 0-D Atmospheric Modeling
detailed_description: F0AM is a MATLAB-based framework for zero-dimensional atmospheric chemistry box modeling, designed to simulate chemical kinetics and photolysis in the atmosphere.

name: AtChem2
one_line_profile: Atmospheric chemistry box-model for the MCM
detailed_description: AtChem2 is a Fortran-based atmospheric chemistry box model that uses the Master Chemical Mechanism (MCM) to simulate complex chemical processes in the atmosphere.

name: DLESyM
one_line_profile: Deep Learning Earth System Model software
detailed_description: DLESyM is a software package for training, running, and analyzing Deep Learning Earth System Models, facilitating the integration of AI into climate modeling.

name: SeaFreeze
one_line_profile: Thermodynamic and elastic properties of water and ice
detailed_description: SeaFreeze is a package for computing the thermodynamic and elastic properties of water and various ice polymorphs (Ih, III, V, VI) over a wide range of pressures and temperatures.

name: C-Coupler2
one_line_profile: Community coupler for model coupling and nesting
detailed_description: C-Coupler2 is a flexible and user-friendly community coupler designed for coupling and nesting various earth system model components.

name: CABLE
one_line_profile: Community Atmosphere Biosphere Land Exchange model
detailed_description: CABLE is a land surface model used to simulate the exchange of momentum, energy, water, and carbon between the land surface and the atmosphere.

name: paleoToolkit
one_line_profile: Paleoclimate tools for CESM
detailed_description: paleoToolkit provides a set of tools and utilities for configuring and running the Community Earth System Model (CESM) for paleoclimate simulations.

name: OceanMesh2D
one_line_profile: Two-dimensional triangular mesh generator for ocean models
detailed_description: OceanMesh2D is a MATLAB-based mesh generation tool designed to build unstructured triangular meshes for coastal ocean circulation models like ADCIRC, FVCOM, and SCHISM.

name: CICE
one_line_profile: Community Sea Ice Model
detailed_description: CICE is a computationally efficient sea ice model that simulates the growth, melt, and movement of sea ice, widely used in global climate and earth system models.

name: ACCESS-OM2 (COSIMA)
one_line_profile: Source code for ACCESS-OM2 ocean-sea ice model
detailed_description: This repository contains the source code and configurations for the ACCESS-OM2 global ocean-sea ice coupled model, maintained by the COSIMA community.

name: ACCESS-OM3
one_line_profile: Source code for ACCESS-OM3 ocean-sea ice-wave model
detailed_description: ACCESS-OM3 is the next-generation global coupled model including ocean (MOM6), sea ice (CICE6), and waves (WW3), developed by the COSIMA community.

name: cice5-access
one_line_profile: ACCESS configuration of CICE5 sea ice model
detailed_description: This is a clone of the Los Alamos CICE sea ice model (version 5.1.2) adapted with drivers for the ACCESS climate model framework.

name: cosima-cookbook
one_line_profile: Framework for analyzing ocean-sea ice model output
detailed_description: The COSIMA Cookbook is a Python framework for indexing, querying, and analyzing output data from ocean and sea ice models, specifically designed for the ACCESS-OM2 suite.

name: regional-mom6
one_line_profile: Regional MOM6 configuration generator
detailed_description: A Python tool for automatically generating regional configurations for the Modular Ocean Model 6 (MOM6), simplifying the setup of regional ocean simulations.

name: CrocoDash
one_line_profile: Regional MOM6 setup package for CESM
detailed_description: CrocoDash is a software package designed to facilitate the setup and configuration of regional MOM6 ocean models within the Community Earth System Model (CESM) framework.

name: RavenHydroFramework
one_line_profile: Raven Hydrological Modelling Framework
detailed_description: Raven is a flexible hydrological modelling framework that allows for the discretization of watersheds and the simulation of hydrological processes using various algorithms.

name: RavenPy
one_line_profile: Python wrapper for Raven hydrological model
detailed_description: RavenPy is a Python wrapper that facilitates the setup, execution, and analysis of the Raven hydrological modelling framework, enabling easier integration into Python workflows.

name: Subzero.jl
one_line_profile: Discrete Element Sea Ice Model in Julia
detailed_description: Subzero.jl is a native Julia implementation of a Discrete Element Method (DEM) sea ice model, designed for simulating sea ice dynamics and mechanics.

name: CHM
one_line_profile: Canadian Hydrological Model
detailed_description: The Canadian Hydrological Model (CHM) is a multi-scale, multi-physics hydrological model designed for cold-region hydrological simulations, focusing on snow and mountain hydrology.

name: SCOPE
one_line_profile: Simulation model for radiative transfer, photosynthesis, and energy fluxes
detailed_description: SCOPE (Soil Canopy Observation, Photochemistry and Energy fluxes) is a vertical integrated radiative transfer and energy balance model. It simulates the transfer of radiation, photosynthesis, and energy fluxes in vegetation and soil.

name: pangu-weather-verify
one_line_profile: Validation tool for Pangu Weather Forecasting Model
detailed_description: A tool designed to validate the Pangu Weather Forecasting Model against real-world meteorological observations, facilitating the assessment of AI-based weather model performance.

name: ClimaCore.jl
one_line_profile: Dynamical core for CliMA Earth system models
detailed_description: ClimaCore.jl provides the dynamical core components for the Climate Machine (CliMA) Earth system model, handling the discretization and solving of fluid dynamics equations on the sphere.

name: ClimaDiagnostics.jl
one_line_profile: Diagnostics framework for CliMA simulations
detailed_description: A framework to define, compute, and output observables and statistics from CliMA simulations, enabling analysis of model outputs.

name: ClimaSeaIce.jl
one_line_profile: Sea ice simulation model for Earth system modeling
detailed_description: Provides coupled and stand-alone simulations of sea ice thermodynamics and dynamics for Earth system modeling applications within the CliMA ecosystem.

name: ClimateMachine.jl
one_line_profile: Earth System Model that learns from data
detailed_description: Climate Machine is a next-generation Earth System Model (ESM) designed to automatically learn from data, integrating physics-based modeling with data-driven approaches.

name: Insolation.jl
one_line_profile: Solar radiation and geometry calculator for climate modeling
detailed_description: Calculates solar radiation and solar geometry, including zenith angle, azimuth angle, and insolation at the top of the atmosphere, specifically for climate science and Earth system modeling.

name: RRTMGP.jl
one_line_profile: Radiative Transfer Model for General Circulation Models
detailed_description: A Julia implementation of the Rapid and accurate Radiative Transfer Model for GCMs (RRTMGP), used for computing radiative fluxes in atmospheric models.

name: SurfaceFluxes.jl
one_line_profile: Surface flux computation library for Earth system models
detailed_description: A package for computing surface fluxes of heat, moisture, and momentum between the atmosphere, ocean, and land components of Earth system models.

name: climt
one_line_profile: Python-based climate modelling toolkit
detailed_description: A toolkit for building and running climate models using Python. It provides a modular framework for combining different physical components and dynamical cores.

name: climate-ref
one_line_profile: Rapid Evaluation Framework for CMIP simulations
detailed_description: A framework designed for the rapid evaluation of CMIP (Coupled Model Intercomparison Project) simulations, facilitating the assessment of climate model performance.

name: qgs
one_line_profile: Quasi-geostrophic atmospheric model
detailed_description: A 2-layer quasi-geostrophic atmospheric model implemented in Python, capable of coupling with simple land or shallow-water ocean components for studying atmospheric dynamics.

name: MetaProteomeAnalyzer
one_line_profile: Analysis and visualization software for metaproteomics data
detailed_description: MetaProteomeAnalyzer (MPA) is a software tool for analyzing and visualizing mass spectrometry-based metaproteomics data, supporting protein identification and quantification.

name: satellite-image-super-resolution
one_line_profile: Super Resolution Imaging System for Satellite Imagery
detailed_description: An end-to-end workflow and model system leveraging Deep Transfer Learning and Computer Vision to perform super-resolution on satellite imagery, specifically for assessing climate action interventions.

name: CryoGrid3
one_line_profile: Land surface model for permafrost environments
detailed_description: A one-dimensional land surface model dedicated to simulating ground temperatures and thermal processes in permafrost environments.

name: CryoGridCommunity
one_line_profile: Community version of the CryoGrid permafrost model
detailed_description: The community version of CryoGrid, a numerical model designed to investigate land surface processes and ground thermal regimes in permafrost environments.

name: BG_Flood
one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated shallow water hydrodynamics model
detailed_description: A numerical model for simulating shallow water hydrodynamics on the GPU, designed for simulating inundation events such as river floods, storm surges, or tsunamis.

name: pywatershed
one_line_profile: Hydrologic model implementation in Python
detailed_description: A hydrologic model implemented in Python, designed to simulate watershed processes and support hydrologic research and analysis.

name: NWPeval
one_line_profile: Evaluation package for numerical weather prediction models
detailed_description: A Python package designed to facilitate the evaluation and analysis of numerical weather prediction (NWP) models against observations or other datasets.

name: DeepSpark
one_line_profile: Open platform for industrial application algorithms and models
detailed_description: An open platform that provides a collection of open source application algorithms and models coupled with industrial applications, including a multi-dimensional evaluation system.

name: Visual HEIFLOW
one_line_profile: Graphical modeling environment for hydrological modeling
detailed_description: A comprehensive graphical modeling environment for integrated hydrological modeling, facilitating the setup and analysis of hydrological simulations.

name: Wflow.jl
one_line_profile: Hydrological modeling framework in Julia
detailed_description: A Julia package for hydrological modeling, providing a framework for running distributed hydrological models.

name: E3SM
one_line_profile: Energy Exascale Earth System Model
detailed_description: The Energy Exascale Earth System Model (E3SM) is a state-of-the-art earth system modeling, simulation, and prediction project that optimizes the use of DOE's high-performance computing facilities.

name: EKAT
one_line_profile: HPC C++ libraries for E3SM ecosystem
detailed_description: A collection of tools and libraries for writing Kokkos-enabled High Performance Computing (HPC) C++ code within the E3SM ecosystem, facilitating efficient model development.

name: e3sm_diags
one_line_profile: Diagnostics package for E3SM
detailed_description: A Python package for evaluating and analyzing the performance of the Energy Exascale Earth System Model (E3SM) through various diagnostic metrics and plots.

name: e3sm_to_cmip
one_line_profile: Tool to convert E3SM output to CMIP format
detailed_description: A tool designed to transform E3SM model output data into the standardized CMIP (Coupled Model Intercomparison Project) format (CMORization).

name: gdess
one_line_profile: Evaluation tool for atmospheric CO2 in Earth system models
detailed_description: A tool for evaluating atmospheric carbon dioxide concentrations as simulated by Earth system models against observational data.

name: iESM
one_line_profile: Integrated Earth System Model coupling GCAM and CESM
detailed_description: The Integrated Earth System Model (iESM) couples the Global Change Assessment Model (GCAM) to the Community Earth System Model (CESM) to study interactions between human and earth systems.

name: polaris
one_line_profile: Testing and analysis framework for E3SM ocean and ice components
detailed_description: A framework for testing and analysis of the OMEGA, MPAS-Ocean, MALI, and MPAS-Seaice components within the E3SM ecosystem.

name: SCREAM
one_line_profile: Exascale global atmosphere model in C++
detailed_description: A global atmosphere model written in C++ (Simple Cloud-Resolving E3SM Atmosphere Model), designed for exascale computing performance.

name: zppy
one_line_profile: Post-processing toolchain for E3SM
detailed_description: A post-processing toolchain for the Energy Exascale Earth System Model (E3SM), automating analysis and visualization tasks.

name: GEM
one_line_profile: Global Environmental Multiscale numerical weather prediction model
detailed_description: The Global Environmental Multiscale (GEM) model is a numerical weather prediction model developed by Environment and Climate Change Canada for operational weather forecasting.

name: librmn
one_line_profile: Library of routines for numerical weather prediction
detailed_description: A collection of core routines and utilities used for numerical weather prediction tasks within the Environment and Climate Change Canada modeling ecosystem.

name: rtm_inv
one_line_profile: Radiative transfer model inversion for crop trait retrieval
detailed_description: A Python-backend tool for performing inversion of radiative transfer models to retrieve crop traits from remote sensing data.

name: CDEPS
one_line_profile: Community Data Models for Earth Prediction Systems
detailed_description: A set of compliant data components (atmosphere, ocean, sea-ice, land, river, wave) designed for coupling within Earth Prediction Systems, facilitating the exchange of forcing data between coupled model components.

name: CESM
one_line_profile: Community Earth System Model
detailed_description: A fully-coupled, global climate model that provides state-of-the-art computer simulations of the Earth's past, present, and future climate states, composed of separate models simultaneously simulating the earth's atmosphere, ocean, land, land-ice, and sea-ice.

name: CTSM
one_line_profile: Community Terrestrial Systems Model
detailed_description: The Community Terrestrial Systems Model (CTSM) includes the Community Land Model (CLM) and serves as the land component for the Community Earth System Model (CESM), simulating land surface processes, hydrology, and biogeochemistry.

name: MOM_interface
one_line_profile: CESM interface to MOM Ocean Model
detailed_description: The interface layer that allows the Modular Ocean Model (MOM) to be coupled and run within the Community Earth System Model (CESM) framework.

name: MOSART
one_line_profile: Model for Scale Adaptive River Transport
detailed_description: A river transport model designed for large-scale applications, serving as the river component in the Community Earth System Model (CESM) to simulate river flow and discharge.

name: POP2-CESM
one_line_profile: Parallel Ocean Program (POP2) in CESM
detailed_description: The Parallel Ocean Program version 2 (POP2) adapted for use as the ocean component within the Community Earth System Model (CESM).

name: SimpleLand
one_line_profile: Simple Land Model for CESM
detailed_description: A simplified land model (SLIM) for the Community Earth System Model (CESM), designed for specific experimental configurations or reduced complexity simulations.

name: visualCaseGen
one_line_profile: GUI for configuring CESM cases
detailed_description: A graphical user interface designed to assist researchers in configuring and setting up cases for the Community Earth System Model (CESM), simplifying the workflow for model execution.

name: ESMValCore
one_line_profile: Core engine for ESMValTool pre-processing
detailed_description: The core library for ESMValTool that handles the pre-processing of data from Earth system models, including data finding, loading, fixing, and checking against CMIP standards.

name: ESMValTool
one_line_profile: Earth System Model Evaluation Tool
detailed_description: A community diagnostics and performance metrics tool for the routine evaluation of Earth system models in CMIP, allowing for comparison against observations and other models.

name: NoahMP
one_line_profile: Noah land surface model with multiparameterization options
detailed_description: A land surface model (LSM) that augments the Noah LSM with multiple parameterization options for key physical processes, used for simulating land-atmosphere interactions.

name: FESOM2
one_line_profile: Finite-volumE Sea ice-Ocean Model version 2
detailed_description: A multi-resolution ocean general circulation model that uses unstructured meshes to simulate ocean dynamics and sea ice, allowing for variable resolution in different regions.

name: HiRAM
one_line_profile: GFDL High Resolution Atmospheric Model
detailed_description: A global high-resolution atmospheric model developed by GFDL, capable of simulating the statistics of tropical storms and significant weather events with high fidelity.

name: PROPTI
one_line_profile: Inverse problem solver for material parameter estimation
detailed_description: An interface tool that couples simulation models (e.g., fire dynamics) with optimization algorithms to solve the inverse problem of material parameter estimation.

name: SPHY
one_line_profile: Spatial Processes in HYdrology model
detailed_description: A spatially distributed hydrological model that integrates key hydrologic processes including glacier melt, snow melt, groundwater, and routing, suitable for basin-scale studies.

name: AeroApps
one_line_profile: Aerosol applications for GEOS-ESM
detailed_description: A collection of aerosol applications supporting mission development, model analysis, and atmospheric radiative transfer within the GEOS Earth System Model framework.

name: GEOSgcm
one_line_profile: GEOS Earth System Model
detailed_description: The Goddard Earth Observing System (GEOS) General Circulation Model (GCM), a comprehensive Earth system model used for weather analysis, prediction, and climate research.

name: GEOSgcm_GridComp
one_line_profile: GEOS GCM Grid Components
detailed_description: Contains the physics and Incremental Analysis Update (IAU) code components for the GEOS Earth System Model.

name: MAPL
one_line_profile: Modeling Analysis and Prediction Layer
detailed_description: A foundation layer of the GEOS architecture that supplements the Earth System Modeling Framework (ESMF) to facilitate the development and coupling of model components.

name: gis4wrf
one_line_profile: QGIS toolkit for WRF model
detailed_description: A QGIS plugin that provides tools for pre-processing, post-processing, visualizing, and running simulations with the Weather Research and Forecasting (WRF) model.

name: pyLBL
one_line_profile: Python line-by-line radiative transfer model
detailed_description: A Python implementation of a line-by-line radiative transfer model for calculating atmospheric transmission and radiance.

name: GRAL GUI
one_line_profile: GUI for GRAL dispersion model
detailed_description: A Graphical User Interface for the atmospheric dispersion model GRAL and the mesoscale wind field model GRAMM, facilitating model configuration and execution.

name: HiPIMS-FLAMEGPU
one_line_profile: Coupled Hydrodynamic and Agent-Based Model
detailed_description: A coupled model framework integrating high-performance hydrodynamic modeling (HiPIMS) with agent-based modeling (FLAMEGPU) to simulate interactions between human activities and flooding.

name: SLABIM
one_line_profile: SLAM dataset coupled with BIM
detailed_description: An open-sourced dataset that couples Simultaneous Localization and Mapping (SLAM) data with Building Information Modeling (BIM) for research in robotics and construction.

name: FastGaussianPuff
one_line_profile: Fast Gaussian Puff Atmospheric Model
detailed_description: A production-grade implementation of the Gaussian Puff Forward Atmospheric Model for simulating atmospheric dispersion.

name: Pangu-Weather-ReadyToGo
one_line_profile: Pangu Weather Model Workflow Wrapper
detailed_description: A workflow tool providing data preparation, inference execution, and result visualization for the Pangu Weather AI model, making the model accessible for research.

name: EEMD-Project
one_line_profile: Ensemble Empirical Mode Decomposition Tool
detailed_description: A MATLAB implementation of the Ensemble Empirical Mode Decomposition (EEMD) algorithm, used for analyzing non-linear and non-stationary time series data.

name: topmodel
one_line_profile: R implementation of the TOPMODEL hydrological model
detailed_description: An R package implementing the TOPMODEL hydrological model, which is a rainfall-runoff model based on the idea that the topography of the catchment determines its hydrological response.

name: ISSM
one_line_profile: Ice-sheet and Sea-level System Model
detailed_description: A massively parallelized, multi-purpose finite-element software capable of simulating the evolution of the polar ice sheets (Greenland and Antarctica) and their contribution to sea-level rise.

name: meic2wrf_hourly
one_line_profile: Emission inventory processing tool for WRF-Chem
detailed_description: A tool for interpolating and distributing MEIC emission inventory data onto WRF-Chem grids, supporting customizable distribution coefficients for atmospheric chemistry modeling.

name: Thermomechanical Gradient Enhanced Damage UMAT
one_line_profile: Abaqus UMAT framework for thermomechanical damage modeling
detailed_description: An Abaqus user material (UMAT) framework for multi-field problems, implementing a thermo-mechanically coupled gradient-enhanced damage model.

name: fv3-jedi
one_line_profile: Interface between JEDI and FV3 based models
detailed_description: The interface layer connecting the Joint Effort for Data assimilation Integration (JEDI) system with the Finite-Volume Cubed-Sphere (FV3) dynamical core, enabling data assimilation for FV3-based weather and climate models.

name: diffesm
one_line_profile: Diffusion model emulator for Earth System Models
detailed_description: A diffusion model software designed to emulate Earth System Models (ESMs) for generating daily temperature and precipitation data, facilitating efficient climate scenario analysis.

name: Hector
one_line_profile: Simple Climate Model (SCM)
detailed_description: An open-source, object-oriented, simple global climate carbon-cycle model. It runs extremely fast and is used for emulating complex climate models and uncertainty analysis.

name: Xanthos
one_line_profile: Global hydrologic modeling framework
detailed_description: An extensible global hydrologic framework designed to quantify water availability and consumption across the globe at various spatial and temporal scales.

name: BESS-JPL
one_line_profile: Breathing Earth System Simulator (BESS) GPP Model
detailed_description: Python implementation of the Breathing Earth System Simulator (BESS) Gross Primary Production (GPP) model, used for estimating global vegetation productivity from satellite data.

name: CO2MPAS-TA
one_line_profile: Vehicle CO2 emission simulator

detailed_description: A tool to create virtual Zarr stores from TIFF files, enabling cloud-native access patterns for legacy geospatial data.

name: Vitessce

detailed_description: Vitessce is a framework for visual integration and exploration of spatial single-cell experiment data.

name: GRIB.jl

detailed_description: A Julia package that provides an interface for reading and writing GRIB files, commonly used in meteorology.

name: zen3geo

detailed_description: A Python library for geospatial data science, facilitating the handling and processing of earth science data.

name: GRIB2

detailed_description: Repository by the World Meteorological Organization (WMO) containing GRIB2 definitions and related utilities.

name: wradlib
one_line_profile: Weather radar data processing library
detailed_description: wradlib is a Python library designed to facilitate the processing of weather radar data.

name: xCDAT
one_line_profile: Xarray Climate Data Analysis Tools
detailed_description: xCDAT is an extension of xarray for climate data analysis on structured grids, providing spatial and temporal averaging utilities.

name: cf-xarray
one_line_profile: Xarray accessor for CF conventions
detailed_description: cf-xarray provides an accessor for xarray objects that interprets Climate and Forecast (CF) metadata conventions.

name: datatree
one_line_profile: Tree-like hierarchical data structure for xarray
detailed_description: Datatree provides a hierarchical, tree-like data structure for xarray, enabling the organization of complex, nested scientific datasets.

name: flox
one_line_profile: Fast GroupBy operations for dask.array
detailed_description: Flox provides optimized GroupBy operations for dask arrays, significantly accelerating aggregations in large-scale climate data analysis.

name: xarray-leaflet
one_line_profile: Xarray extension for tiled map plotting
detailed_description: An xarray extension that enables interactive tiled map plotting of geospatial data directly from xarray objects.

name: xbatcher
one_line_profile: Batch generation from xarray datasets for ML
detailed_description: Xbatcher is a library for generating batches from xarray datasets, facilitating the integration of multi-dimensional climate data with machine learning frameworks.

name: xdggs
one_line_profile: Xarray extension for Discrete Global Grid Systems (DGGS)
detailed_description: xdggs is an xarray extension for working with Discrete Global Grid Systems, enabling analysis on non-traditional global grids.

name: xeofs
one_line_profile: Comprehensive EOF analysis and related techniques for xarray data
detailed_description: A Python package for performing Empirical Orthogonal Function (EOF) analysis, also known as Principal Component Analysis (PCA), on multidimensional Earth system data. It integrates seamlessly with xarray to handle labeled dimensions and coordinates.

name: xncml
one_line_profile: Utilities for manipulating NcML (NetCDF Markup Language) with xarray
detailed_description: A Python toolset for working with NcML, an XML representation of NetCDF metadata. It allows opening NcML datasets directly into xarray, facilitating the aggregation and modification of NetCDF datasets without rewriting files.

name: xvec
one_line_profile: Vector data cubes support for Xarray
detailed_description: A Python library that extends xarray to support vector data (points, polygons, lines) alongside raster data. It enables geometric operations and spatial indexing on xarray datasets, bridging the gap between raster and vector geospatial analysis.

name: xcube
one_line_profile: Python package for generating and exploiting Earth Observation data cubes
detailed_description: A tool for converting Earth Observation data into cloud-optimized data cubes. It leverages xarray, dask, and zarr to provide efficient access, analysis, and visualization of large-scale spatiotemporal data.

name: xrft
one_line_profile: Fourier transforms for xarray data structures
detailed_description: A Python library that wraps scipy and numpy FFT functions to work directly with xarray objects. It handles grid coordinates, preserves metadata, and supports out-of-core computation via dask for spectral analysis of climate and oceanographic data.

name: sciBASIC
one_line_profile: Scientific computing library for VB.NET/Visual Basic
detailed_description: A scientific computing library designed for the .NET ecosystem, providing data structures and algorithms for data scientists using Visual Basic. It covers various domains including bioinformatics and general data analysis.

name: xpublish
one_line_profile: Publish Xarray Datasets via a REST API
detailed_description: A Python library that allows users to serve xarray datasets via a REST API. It enables the sharing of scientific data through standard web protocols, making it easier to integrate climate models and data into web applications and visualization tools.

name: xtensor-zarr
one_line_profile: C++ implementation of the Zarr core protocol using xtensor
detailed_description: A C++ library that provides Zarr storage support for the xtensor ecosystem. It enables efficient reading and writing of chunked, compressed N-dimensional arrays in the Zarr format, facilitating high-performance scientific computing in C++.

name: py-wsi
one_line_profile: Whole Slide Image (WSI) processing for machine learning
detailed_description: A Python package for handling Whole Slide Images (.svs) in digital pathology. It provides functionality for patch sampling, storage (LMDB/HDF5), and preprocessing, designed to facilitate machine learning workflows on large bio-images.

name: VirtualiZarr
one_line_profile: Create virtual Zarr stores from legacy data formats
detailed_description: A tool to create 'virtual' Zarr stores that reference data in other formats (like NetCDF) without duplication. It enables cloud-optimized access patterns on legacy archival data using xarray syntax.

name: pydantic-zarr
one_line_profile: Pydantic models for Zarr metadata validation
detailed_description: A Python library providing Pydantic models to validate and structure Zarr hierarchy and metadata. It ensures data integrity and type safety when working with Zarr storage specifications.

name: zarr-python
one_line_profile: Python implementation of chunked, compressed, N-dimensional arrays
detailed_description: The reference Python implementation of the Zarr storage format. It provides a NumPy-like interface for working with large, chunked arrays stored in various backends (local, cloud, zip), essential for modern scientific data storage.

name: zarrs
one_line_profile: Rust library for the Zarr storage format
detailed_description: A high-performance Rust implementation of the Zarr V3 and V2 specifications. It provides core functionality for reading and writing Zarr data, suitable for building performant scientific applications in Rust.

name: zarrs-python
one_line_profile: Python bindings for the zarrs Rust crate
detailed_description: Provides accelerated codec pipelines for Zarr in Python by leveraging the Rust-based `zarrs` library. It aims to improve performance for encoding and decoding Zarr data within the Python ecosystem.

name: ZnH5MD
one_line_profile: High Performance Interface for H5MD Trajectories
detailed_description: A Python interface for reading and writing H5MD (HDF5 for Molecular Dynamics) files. It provides efficient access to molecular trajectory data, facilitating analysis in computational chemistry and materials science.

name: COSPv2.0

detailed_description: A software package that simulates satellite observations from climate model output, enabling direct comparison between models and satellite data.

name: ctf4science

detailed_description: A modular framework designed for benchmarking modeling methods on dynamic systems like ODEs and PDEs using standardized datasets and metrics.

name: UNSEEN-open

detailed_description: An open, reproducible workflow to assess and anticipate climate extremes beyond the observed record using large ensemble simulations.

name: CVDP-LE

detailed_description: A Python framework designed to facilitate verification, validation, and uncertainty quantification (VVUQ) for a wide variety of scientific simulations.
