name: Time-Series-Library
one_line_profile: Deep learning library for advanced time series analysis
detailed_description: A comprehensive open-source library implementing state-of-the-art deep learning models for time series forecasting, imputation, classification, and anomaly detection. It serves as a benchmark and toolkit for time series research.

name: PyOD
one_line_profile: A comprehensive Python toolkit for detecting outlying objects in multivariate data
detailed_description: PyOD is a comprehensive and scalable Python toolkit for detecting outlying objects in multivariate data. It includes more than 30 detection algorithms, ranging from classical techniques like LOF (Local Outlier Factor) to deep learning models like AutoEncoders. It is widely used for data cleaning, quality control, and anomaly detection in scientific time-series and sensor data.

name: Flow Forecast
one_line_profile: Deep learning library for time series forecasting and anomaly detection
detailed_description: A deep learning PyTorch library specifically designed for time series forecasting, classification, and anomaly detection, with a focus on flood forecasting and environmental data.

name: CRITERIA3D
one_line_profile: Three-dimensional agro-hydrological model
detailed_description: A three-dimensional agro-hydrological model for small catchments, simulating water flow and transport in soil and plants.

name: Raven Hydrological Modelling Framework
one_line_profile: Flexible and modular hydrological modelling framework
detailed_description: A robust hydrological modelling framework that allows for the discretization of watersheds and simulation of hydrological processes using various algorithms.

name: Canadian Hydrological Model (CHM)
one_line_profile: Modular, multi-physics, spatially distributed hydrological model
detailed_description: A modular, multi-physics, spatially distributed hydrological model designed for cold-region hydrological processes and snow modeling.

name: HyperTS
one_line_profile: Full-Pipeline Automated Time Series (AutoTS) Analysis Toolkit
detailed_description: A comprehensive Python toolkit for automated time series analysis, including forecasting, classification, and regression, designed to simplify the machine learning pipeline for time-series data.

name: Visual-HEIFLOW
one_line_profile: Graphical modeling environment for integrated hydrological modeling
detailed_description: A comprehensive graphical user interface and modeling environment for HEIFLOW, facilitating integrated hydrological modeling and visualization.

name: DGDM
one_line_profile: Probabilistic Weather Forecasting with Deterministic Guidance-based Diffusion Model
detailed_description: Implementation of a diffusion model-based approach for probabilistic weather forecasting, leveraging deterministic guidance to improve prediction accuracy.

name: CorrSTN
one_line_profile: Correlation information-based spatiotemporal network for traffic flow forecasting
detailed_description: A deep learning model designed for traffic flow forecasting that incorporates correlation information to capture spatiotemporal dependencies.

name: ManyFEWS
one_line_profile: The Many Flood Early Warning System
detailed_description: A flood early warning system developed by Durham University's Advanced Research Computing, designed to provide alerts and monitoring for flood risks.

name: CLCRN
one_line_profile: Conditional Local Convolution for Spatio-temporal Meteorological Forecasting
detailed_description: PyTorch implementation of the CLCRN model for spatio-temporal meteorological forecasting, as presented at AAAI 2022.

name: BiodiversityTools
one_line_profile: Spatial biodiversity modelling tools by NSW DCCEEW
detailed_description: A suite of spatial biodiversity modelling tools and code developed by the Metrics and Forecasting Ecological Modelling Team at NSW DCCEEW.

name: KAT
one_line_profile: K-mer Analysis Toolkit
detailed_description: A suite of tools for analyzing and comparing K-mer spectra from DNA sequencing data, useful for quality control and genomic analysis.

name: ST-SSL
one_line_profile: Spatio-Temporal Self-Supervised Learning for Traffic Flow Forecasting
detailed_description: Implementation of a self-supervised learning framework for spatio-temporal traffic flow forecasting.

name: ecoforecastR
one_line_profile: Statistical and informatic tools for ecological forecasting in R
detailed_description: An R package providing general statistical and informatic tools specifically designed for ecological forecasting applications.

name: epidemiar
one_line_profile: R package for EPIDEMIA forecasting system
detailed_description: An R package containing modeling, forecasting, and early warning tools for the EPIDEMIA system, integrating surveillance and environmental data for disease forecasting.

name: HighAir
one_line_profile: Hierarchical Graph Neural Network-Based Air Quality Forecasting
detailed_description: Source code for HighAir, a method using hierarchical graph neural networks for forecasting air quality.

name: grin
one_line_profile: Multivariate Time Series Imputation by Graph Neural Networks
detailed_description: Official implementation of the GRIN model for filling gaps in multivariate time series data using Graph Neural Networks.

name: EF5
one_line_profile: Ensemble Framework For Flash Flood Forecasting
detailed_description: A hydrological modelling framework designed for flash flood forecasting. It provides an ensemble approach to simulate and predict flood events, supporting research in hydrology and disaster management.

name: hydrate
one_line_profile: Tool to setup and run hydrologic models using Earth Engine data
detailed_description: A Python package designed to streamline the setup and execution of hydrologic models by automatically retrieving and processing necessary data from Google Earth Engine. It simplifies the workflow for hydrological modeling.

name: Multivariate-Time-Series-Imputation-with-Generative-Adversarial-Networks
one_line_profile: GAN-based imputation for multivariate time series data
detailed_description: An implementation of a Generative Adversarial Network (GAN) framework designed to impute missing values in multivariate time series data, useful for preprocessing environmental sensor data.

name: STGM
one_line_profile: Spatio-Temporal Graph Mixformer for traffic forecasting
detailed_description: A deep learning model (Spatio-Temporal Graph Mixformer) designed for forecasting traffic flow, which serves as a proxy for mobile source emission estimation in environmental modeling.

name: DARTS (Medical)
one_line_profile: DenseUnet-based tool for brain segmentation
detailed_description: A DenseUnet-based Automatic Rapid Tool for brain Segmentation, providing a deep learning solution for medical image analysis.

name: GDM
one_line_profile: Early-warning signals of disintegration in complex systems
detailed_description: A library implementing machine learning dismantling and early-warning signals for analyzing the disintegration of complex systems/networks.

name: statsforecast
one_line_profile: Fast forecasting with statistical and econometric models
detailed_description: A comprehensive library for lightning-fast time series forecasting using statistical and econometric models, widely used for environmental and economic time series analysis.

name: Prophet_Explore
one_line_profile: Interactive interface for Facebook Prophet
detailed_description: A Shiny App that provides an interactive GUI to explore and visualize the functions and forecasts of the Prophet time series forecasting package.

name: Raven
one_line_profile: WPS services for hydrological modeling
detailed_description: Web Processing Services (WPS) wrapper for hydrological modeling capabilities, facilitating the integration of hydrology models into web workflows.

name: Ozon3
one_line_profile: Real-time and historical air quality data fetcher
detailed_description: A Python package to easily obtain real-time, historical, or forecasted air quality data for locations worldwide.

name: point-cloud-prediction
one_line_profile: Self-supervised point cloud prediction
detailed_description: A library for self-supervised prediction of 3D point clouds using Spatio-temporal Convolutional Networks, applicable in robotics and environmental sensing.

name: PEcAn
one_line_profile: Predictive Ecosystem Analyzer toolbox
detailed_description: The Predictive Ecosystem Analyzer (PEcAn) is an integrated ecological bioinformatics toolbox for ecosystem modeling, data analysis, and forecasting.

name: SED-EEW-SeisComP-contributions
one_line_profile: Libraries and modules for Earthquake Early Warning (EEW) integrated with SeisComP
detailed_description: A collection of libraries and modules developed by the Swiss Seismological Service (SED) at ETH Zurich for the SeisComP seismological software system. It focuses on Earthquake Early Warning (EEW) capabilities, providing algorithms and tools for real-time seismic monitoring and alert generation.

name: SORMAS
one_line_profile: Surveillance, Outbreak Response Management and Analysis System
detailed_description: SORMAS is an open-source mobile and web application for the management of disease control and outbreak response. It provides tools for early warning, surveillance, and analysis of infectious disease spread, facilitating real-time data exchange between health workers.

name: TerraMA2
one_line_profile: Computational platform for environmental early warning systems
detailed_description: TerraMA is a free and open-source software platform designed for developing early warning systems for environmental risks such as floods, fires, and landslides. It integrates data collection, monitoring, analysis, and alert dissemination.

name: AgML-CY-Bench
one_line_profile: Benchmark dataset for crop yield forecasting
detailed_description: A comprehensive benchmark dataset and standardization framework for forecasting crop yields at the subnational level. It harmonizes public yield statistics with climate and remote sensing predictors to facilitate machine learning research in agriculture.

name: DARTS (RNA-seq)
one_line_profile: Deep-learning Augmented RNA-seq analysis of Transcript Splicing
detailed_description: A deep learning framework for predicting transcript splicing from RNA-seq data. It leverages deep neural networks to augment standard RNA-seq analysis, improving the detection of alternative splicing events.

name: prophet-ruby
one_line_profile: Ruby client for the Prophet time series forecasting procedure
detailed_description: A Ruby wrapper for Facebook's Prophet library, enabling time series forecasting with additive models for trends and seasonality in Ruby applications.

name: streamlit_prophet
one_line_profile: Web-based application to train, evaluate, and optimize Prophet forecasting models
detailed_description: A Streamlit-based graphical interface for the Prophet forecasting library, allowing users to visually train models, evaluate performance, and optimize parameters without writing code.

name: GluonTS
one_line_profile: Probabilistic time series modeling library based on deep learning
detailed_description: A comprehensive library for probabilistic time series modeling, providing state-of-the-art deep learning models for forecasting and anomaly detection.

name: PyTorch Geometric Temporal
one_line_profile: Temporal extension library for PyTorch Geometric for spatiotemporal signal processing
detailed_description: A temporal extension library for PyTorch Geometric, designed for spatiotemporal signal processing and dynamic graph neural networks, widely used in traffic and environmental forecasting.

name: PROPhet
one_line_profile: Tool integrating machine learning with first-principles quantum chemistry approaches
detailed_description: A code designed to integrate machine learning techniques with first-principles quantum chemistry approaches for property prediction and modeling.

name: modeltime
one_line_profile: R framework for time series forecasting and machine learning integration
detailed_description: A comprehensive R framework that integrates classical time series models and machine learning algorithms for forecasting, streamlining the workflow of model training and evaluation.

name: modeltime.gluonts
one_line_profile: GluonTS deep learning backend for the Modeltime forecasting framework
detailed_description: An extension for the Modeltime framework that provides a backend for GluonTS, enabling the use of deep learning probabilistic forecasting models within the R ecosystem.

name: superflexPy
one_line_profile: Flexible framework for building hydrological models
detailed_description: An open-source Python framework that allows users to construct flexible and customized hydrological models, facilitating the testing of different model structures and hypotheses.

name: elapid
one_line_profile: Species distribution modeling tools
detailed_description: A Python library for species distribution modeling, including a re-implementation of Maxent, designed to handle geospatial data for ecological research.

name: Prophet
one_line_profile: Forecasting procedure for time series data with seasonality and trends
detailed_description: A procedure for forecasting time series data based on an additive model where non-linear trends are fit with yearly, weekly, and daily seasonality, plus holiday effects. It works best with time series that have strong seasonal effects and several seasons of historical data.

name: Kats
one_line_profile: Kit to Analyze Time Series for forecasting, detection, and feature extraction
detailed_description: A lightweight, easy-to-use, generalizable, and extendable framework to perform time series analysis. It includes modules for forecasting, anomaly detection, change point detection, and feature extraction, suitable for environmental sensor data analysis.

name: soothsayer
one_line_profile: Elixir library for time series forecasting
detailed_description: A time series forecasting library for Elixir, inspired by Facebook's Prophet and NeuralProphet. It allows for building forecasting models in Elixir-based data pipelines.

name: CrossViVit
one_line_profile: Spatio-Temporal Context model for Solar Irradiance Forecasting
detailed_description: Implementation of the CrossViVit model for improving day-ahead solar irradiance time series forecasting by leveraging spatio-temporal context from satellite data.

name: ASTGCN-pytorch
one_line_profile: Attention Based Spatial-Temporal Graph Convolutional Networks for Traffic Flow Forecasting
detailed_description: PyTorch implementation of ASTGCN, a model for traffic flow forecasting that captures spatial-temporal dependencies using graph convolutional networks and attention mechanisms.

name: HydPy
one_line_profile: Framework for development and application of hydrological models
detailed_description: A Python framework designed for the development, testing, and application of hydrological models. It supports various model structures and simplifies the process of handling hydrological data and simulations.

name: pm-prophet
one_line_profile: PyMC3-based implementation of Prophet for time series modeling
detailed_description: A probabilistic time series modeling library inspired by Facebook Prophet but implemented using PyMC3. It allows for generalized additive models (GAM) with automatic changepoint detection, suitable for forecasting environmental time series data.

name: FOST
one_line_profile: General forecasting tool for spatial-temporal and hierarchical data
detailed_description: A general-purpose forecasting tool developed by Microsoft, designed to handle complex forecasting domains including temporal, spatial-temporal, and hierarchical data. It aims to address the limitations of existing tools in processing structural graph data for spatial domains.

name: fable.prophet
one_line_profile: Fable extension for Prophet forecasting
detailed_description: An R package that provides a wrapper for the Prophet forecasting procedure, allowing it to be used within the 'fable' framework for tidy time series analysis and forecasting.

name: neuralhydrology
one_line_profile: Deep learning library for hydrology
detailed_description: A Python library designed to train and evaluate deep neural networks for hydrological applications, such as rainfall-runoff modeling, with a focus on research reproducibility.

name: diffusion_weather
one_line_profile: Diffusion models for weather and PV forecasting
detailed_description: A repository implementing and exploring diffusion-based generative models specifically for weather forecasting and photovoltaic (PV) power generation prediction.

name: NeuralProphet
one_line_profile: Hybrid forecasting framework based on PyTorch
detailed_description: A user-friendly time series forecasting framework that bridges the gap between traditional decomposition models (like Prophet) and deep learning methods, supporting auto-regression, covariates, and events.

name: TopoFlow
one_line_profile: Component-based spatial hydrologic modeling framework
detailed_description: TopoFlow is a component-based, spatial hydrologic model that includes utilities for data preparation and visualization. It is designed to simulate hydrologic processes in a spatially distributed manner.

name: Catchment Modelling Framework (cmf)
one_line_profile: A modular framework for hydrologic modelling
detailed_description: The Catchment Modelling Framework (cmf) is a toolbox for creating hydrologic models, allowing for flexible connection of water transport processes.

name: PySHRED
one_line_profile: Package for Shallow Recurrent Decoding of time-series sensors
detailed_description: PySHRED is a Python package implementing Shallow Recurrent Decoding (SHRED), a method for sensing and reconstructing high-dimensional spatiotemporal fields from sparse sensor measurements.

name: Merlion
one_line_profile: A Machine Learning Framework for Time Series Intelligence
detailed_description: Merlion is a Python library for time series intelligence. It provides an end-to-end machine learning framework that includes loading and transforming data, building and training models, post-processing model outputs, and evaluating model performance. It supports various time series learning tasks, including forecasting and anomaly detection, making it highly relevant for environmental monitoring data.

name: Conformal Tights
one_line_profile: Conformal prediction for scikit-learn regressors and Darts forecasters
detailed_description: Conformal Tights is a library that adds conformal prediction capabilities to any scikit-learn regressor or Darts forecaster. It enables the generation of coherent quantiles and prediction intervals, providing rigorous uncertainty quantification for time series forecasting and regression models.

name: LazyProphet
one_line_profile: Time Series Forecasting with LightGBM wrapper
detailed_description: A Python library that simplifies time series forecasting by wrapping LightGBM, allowing for efficient recursive forecasting with minimal code.

name: Corrformer
one_line_profile: Interpretable Weather Forecasting with Unified Deep Model
detailed_description: Implementation of the Corrformer model for worldwide weather forecasting, as published in Nature Machine Intelligence, providing a unified deep learning approach for meteorological data.

name: multi-prophet
one_line_profile: Multivariate forecasting with Facebook Prophet
detailed_description: A Python package that encapsulates multivariate forecasting capabilities using Facebook Prophet, enabling easier handling of multiple time series.

name: MARRMoT
one_line_profile: Modular Assessment of Rainfall-Runoff Models Toolbox
detailed_description: A MATLAB toolbox containing code for 47 conceptual hydrologic models, allowing for modular assessment and comparison of rainfall-runoff models.

name: WRF
one_line_profile: Weather Research and Forecasting Model
detailed_description: A next-generation mesoscale numerical weather prediction system designed for both atmospheric research and operational forecasting applications.

name: xwrf
one_line_profile: Xarray interface for WRF model output
detailed_description: A lightweight Python interface for working with the Weather Research and Forecasting (WRF) model output using Xarray, facilitating data analysis and visualization.

name: PyTorchTS
one_line_profile: Probabilistic time series forecasting framework based on PyTorch
detailed_description: PyTorchTS is a probabilistic time series forecasting library built on top of PyTorch and GluonTS. It provides state-of-the-art deep learning models for forecasting complex temporal dynamics, making it suitable for environmental monitoring tasks such as weather prediction and pollution concentration forecasting.

name: CEVAE
one_line_profile: Deep latent-variable model for causal effect inference
detailed_description: A TensorFlow implementation of the Causal Effect Variational Autoencoder (CEVAE), designed to estimate causal effects from observational data by leveraging deep latent-variable models to adjust for confounding.

name: CATENets
one_line_profile: Neural network-based estimators for Conditional Average Treatment Effects
detailed_description: A Python library providing Scikit-learn compatible implementations of various neural network-based methods for estimating Conditional Average Treatment Effects (CATE), including S-Learner, T-Learner, TARNet, and DragonNet.

name: causallib
one_line_profile: Modular causal inference analysis and model evaluation tool
detailed_description: A comprehensive Python package for causal inference, providing a modular API for estimating treatment effects using various statistical and machine learning models, along with tools for model evaluation and validation.

name: pycirk
one_line_profile: Modeling Circular Economy policy interventions in Input-Output Analysis
detailed_description: A Python package designed to model Circular Economy policy and technological interventions within Environmentally Extended Input-Output Analysis (EEIOA), specifically tailored for use with mrSUTs (EXIOBASE).

name: CausalRivers
one_line_profile: Benchmark package for causal discovery on river data
detailed_description: A benchmark package and dataset for evaluating causal discovery methods using real-world time series data from river networks, facilitating the comparison of algorithms in environmental science contexts.

name: VLTimeSeriesCausality
one_line_profile: Variable-lag Granger causality and transfer entropy inference
detailed_description: A framework for inferring causality between pairs of time series using Variable-lag Granger causality and transfer entropy, suitable for analyzing temporal dependencies in complex systems.

name: YLearn
one_line_profile: All-in-one causal learning and inference package
detailed_description: A comprehensive Python package for causal inference that supports various aspects of the causal learning process, including causal discovery, treatment effect estimation, and policy evaluation.

name: DoubleML-Python
one_line_profile: Double Machine Learning framework in Python
detailed_description: The Python implementation of the Double Machine Learning framework, enabling the estimation of causal effects using machine learning methods while accounting for high-dimensional nuisance parameters.

name: DoubleML-R
one_line_profile: Double Machine Learning framework in R
detailed_description: The R implementation of the Double Machine Learning framework, providing tools for causal inference and treatment effect estimation using machine learning techniques.

name: DoubleML-Serverless
one_line_profile: Serverless architecture extension for distributed Double Machine Learning
detailed_description: An extension for the DoubleML library that enables distributed Double Machine Learning calculations using a serverless architecture, facilitating scalable causal inference.

name: CausalDiscoveryToolbox
one_line_profile: Comprehensive Python package for causal inference and graph structure recovery
detailed_description: A Python package for causal inference in graphs and pairwise settings, including tools for graph structure recovery and dependency analysis.

name: GenomicSEM
one_line_profile: Structural equation modeling tool for GWAS summary statistics
detailed_description: An R package for structural equation modeling based on GWAS summary data, allowing for the analysis of multivariate genetic architecture.

name: Causality Lab
one_line_profile: Causal discovery algorithms and experimentation platform
detailed_description: A collection of causal discovery algorithms and tools for implementing and benchmarking new ones, developed by Intel Labs.

name: dsem
one_line_profile: Dynamic structural equation models for spatial and temporal data
detailed_description: An R package for fitting dynamic structural equation models, particularly useful for spatial and temporal data analysis in ecology and environmental science.

name: Associations.jl
one_line_profile: Julia algorithms for associations, independence testing, and causal inference
detailed_description: A Julia package providing algorithms for quantifying associations, performing independence tests, and conducting causal inference from data.

name: CSLE
one_line_profile: Cyber Security Learning Environment for developing automated security policies
detailed_description: A research platform to develop automated security policies using quantitative methods such as reinforcement learning, game theory, and causal inference.

name: TCDF
one_line_profile: Temporal Causal Discovery Framework for discovering causal relationships in time series
detailed_description: A PyTorch-based framework for discovering causal relationships between time series data, utilizing attention-based convolutional neural networks.

name: CATEs
one_line_profile: Machine learning estimation of heterogeneous causal effects
detailed_description: An R package providing methods for the machine learning estimation of heterogeneous causal effects (CATEs).

name: causalDML
one_line_profile: Implementation of Double Machine Learning for causal inference
detailed_description: An R package implementing Double Machine Learning methods for causal inference, facilitating robust estimation of causal effects.

name: dmlmt
one_line_profile: R package for Double Machine Learning with Multiple Treatments
detailed_description: An R package implementing Double Machine Learning (DML) methods specifically designed for scenarios involving multiple treatments. It facilitates causal inference by combining machine learning predictive models with econometric techniques to estimate treatment effects.

name: cause2e
one_line_profile: End-to-end causal analysis pipeline in Python
detailed_description: A Python package designed to streamline the entire causal analysis workflow, from causal discovery to effect estimation. It provides a high-level interface for performing end-to-end causal inference on datasets.

name: sherlock
one_line_profile: Causal machine learning for segment discovery
detailed_description: An R package developed by Netflix for causal machine learning, specifically focused on segment discovery and analysis to identify heterogeneous treatment effects.

name: ucate
one_line_profile: Uncertainty in Conditional Average Treatment Effect Estimation
detailed_description: A Python library for estimating uncertainty in Conditional Average Treatment Effect (CATE) predictions, developed by the Oxford Applied and Theoretical Machine Learning Group.

name: RiskStratifiedEstimation
one_line_profile: Risk-stratified treatment effect estimation
detailed_description: An R package from OHDSI for evaluating treatment effect heterogeneity using a risk-based approach, allowing for the assessment of how treatment effects vary across different risk strata.

name: OpenASCE
one_line_profile: Open All-Scale Causal Engine for large-scale causal learning
detailed_description: A comprehensive Python package for end-to-end large-scale causal learning, providing algorithms for causal discovery, causal effect estimation, and attribution.

name: OpenMx
one_line_profile: Extended Structural Equation Modeling
detailed_description: A powerful and flexible R package for Structural Equation Modeling (SEM), allowing for the specification, estimation, and analysis of a wide variety of statistical models.

name: SyntheticControlMethods
one_line_profile: Causal inference using Synthetic Control Methods
detailed_description: A Python package implementing Synthetic Control Methods for causal inference, useful for estimating the effect of interventions in comparative case studies.

name: bicycle
one_line_profile: Intervention-Based Causal Discovery with Cycles
detailed_description: A library for causal discovery that can handle cyclic graphs using intervention data, useful for biological and complex system modeling.

name: CImpact
one_line_profile: Causal inference library for time series analysis
detailed_description: A Python library developed by Sanofi for performing causal inference on time series data, enabling the assessment of interventions in temporal datasets.

name: StructuralEquationModels.jl
one_line_profile: Fast and flexible Structural Equation Modelling in Julia
detailed_description: A Julia package for Structural Equation Modeling (SEM) that emphasizes performance and flexibility, allowing for the definition and estimation of complex latent variable models.

name: fast-causal-inference
one_line_profile: High-performance causal inference computing library based on OLAP
detailed_description: A high-performance causal inference (statistical model) computing library based on OLAP, designed to solve performance bottlenecks of existing statistical model libraries (R/Python) under big data scenarios.

name: Granger-causality
one_line_profile: Efficient implementation of Granger causality and its extensions
detailed_description: A repository containing efficient implementations of Granger causality and its extensions, developed by the USC Melady Lab.

name: nlpsem
one_line_profile: R package for analyzing nonlinear longitudinal processes in SEM
detailed_description: An R package for analyzing nonlinear longitudinal processes within the structural equation modeling (SEM) framework, suitable for complex causal modeling.

name: pyGC
one_line_profile: Granger Causality library in Python
detailed_description: A Python library dedicated to performing Granger Causality tests on time series data.

name: tfcausalimpact
one_line_profile: Python Causal Impact Implementation using TensorFlow Probability
detailed_description: A Python implementation of Google's Causal Impact algorithm (originally in R), built using TensorFlow Probability for estimating causal effects of interventions on time series.

name: mlcausality
one_line_profile: Nonlinear Granger causality using machine learning techniques
detailed_description: A Python library for estimating nonlinear Granger causality using machine learning techniques, such as Kernel Ridge Regression.

name: PyCausality
one_line_profile: Predictive causality between time series using information-theoretic techniques
detailed_description: A Python library to calculate predictive causality between time series using information-theoretic techniques like Transfer Entropy.

name: psmpy
one_line_profile: Propensity score matching in Python
detailed_description: A Python package for propensity score matching (PSM), facilitating causal inference by balancing covariates in observational data.

name: causalnlp
one_line_profile: Toolkit for causal inference with text
detailed_description: A practical toolkit for causal inference where text is used as a treatment, outcome, or controlled-for variable.

name: causeinfer
one_line_profile: Machine learning based causal inference/uplift in Python
detailed_description: A Python package for machine learning-based causal inference and uplift modeling, providing standard algorithms for treatment effect estimation.

name: causalDisco
one_line_profile: Tools for causal discovery in R
detailed_description: An R package providing tools and algorithms for causal discovery from data.

name: causalforge
one_line_profile: Suite of modeling & causal inference methods
detailed_description: A Python package providing a suite of modeling and causal inference methods using machine learning algorithms, developed by Anthem AI (Elevance Health).

name: asympPDC
one_line_profile: MATLAB package for Partial Directed Coherence (PDC) estimation
detailed_description: A MATLAB and Octave package for Partial Directed Coherence (PDC) and Directed Transfer Function (DTF) estimation with asymptotic statistics, used for Granger Causality analysis.

name: linearmodels
one_line_profile: Linear models including instrumental variable and panel data models
detailed_description: A Python library that extends statsmodels with additional linear models, specifically focusing on instrumental variable (IV) models and panel data models for econometrics and causal inference.

name: kmatch
one_line_profile: Stata module for multivariate-distance and propensity-score matching
detailed_description: A Stata package implementing various matching methods for causal inference, including multivariate-distance matching, propensity-score matching, entropy balancing, and inverse probability weighting.

name: drtmle
one_line_profile: Doubly-robust nonparametric estimators for average treatment effects
detailed_description: An R package that provides nonparametric estimators of the average treatment effect with doubly-robust confidence intervals and hypothesis tests, utilizing targeted minimum loss-based estimation (TMLE).

name: DeepSCM
one_line_profile: Deep Structural Causal Models for counterfactual inference
detailed_description: A framework for Deep Structural Causal Models (DeepSCM) that enables tractable counterfactual inference by combining deep learning with structural causal models, particularly for medical imaging and other high-dimensional data.

name: causal-text-embeddings
one_line_profile: Causal inference using text embeddings
detailed_description: A Python toolkit for performing causal inference on text data by leveraging text embeddings to adjust for confounding variables found in natural language.

name: Onyx
one_line_profile: Graphical interface for Structural Equation Modeling
detailed_description: A standalone software application for Structural Equation Modeling (SEM) that provides a graphical user interface for model specification, estimation, and visualization.

name: semtree
one_line_profile: Recursive partitioning for Structural Equation Models
detailed_description: An R package that implements recursive partitioning (trees and forests) for Structural Equation Models (SEM) to detect heterogeneity in model parameters.

name: CausalMatch
one_line_profile: Automated decision-making via causal inference and machine learning
detailed_description: A research project and toolkit integrating machine learning and econometrics methods (specifically matching and causal inference) to automate decision-making processes.

name: causy
one_line_profile: User-friendly causal discovery library
detailed_description: A Python library designed to make causal discovery algorithms accessible and easy to use, supporting various methods for inferring causal structures from data.

name: lingam
one_line_profile: Causal discovery using Linear Non-Gaussian Acyclic Models
detailed_description: A Python package implementing LiNGAM (Linear Non-Gaussian Acyclic Model) algorithms for causal discovery, allowing estimation of causal structures from observational data.

name: defuse
one_line_profile: Nonlinear causal discovery with confounders
detailed_description: A Python package for nonlinear causal discovery in the presence of latent confounders, implementing the Deconfounding via Unsupervised Learning (DEFUSE) method.

name: causal_discovery_for_time_series
one_line_profile: Library for causal discovery in time series data
detailed_description: A collection of algorithms and tools for performing causal discovery specifically on time series data, including implementations and wrappers for various methods like PCMCI and Granger causality.

name: CausalGPS
one_line_profile: Matching on Generalized Propensity Scores with Continuous Exposures
detailed_description: An R package for causal inference with continuous treatments, implementing matching on generalized propensity scores (GPS) to adjust for confounding.

name: Matching
one_line_profile: Multivariate and Propensity Score Matching with Balance Optimization
detailed_description: An R package providing functions for multivariate and propensity score matching, including genetic search algorithms to find optimal balance.

name: cxplain
one_line_profile: Causal explanations for machine learning models
detailed_description: A Python library for explaining the predictions of machine learning models using causal reasoning, providing insights into feature importance and causal drivers of model outputs.

name: KernelGrangerCausality
one_line_profile: Nonlinear Granger causality using kernel methods
detailed_description: A MATLAB toolkit for evaluating nonlinear Granger causality using the kernel trick, allowing for the detection of complex causal relationships in time series data.

name: market-impact-renewables
one_line_profile: Double Machine Learning toolkit for Energy Analytics
detailed_description: An applied machine learning toolkit implementing Double Machine Learning (DML) specifically tailored for energy analytics and market impact analysis of renewables.

one_line_profile: Methods for spatial data analysis with raster and vector data
detailed_description: terra is a robust R package for spatial data handling, replacing the 'raster' package. It provides fast methods for raster and vector data manipulation and analysis.

name: PySALT
one_line_profile: Reduction and analysis software for SALT (Southern African Large Telescope) data
detailed_description: PySALT is the primary software package for the reduction and analysis of astronomical data from the Southern African Large Telescope (SALT).

name: SfePy
one_line_profile: Simple Finite Elements in Python for solving PDEs
detailed_description: SfePy is a software for solving systems of coupled partial differential equations (PDEs) by the finite element method in 1D, 2D and 3D.

name: Bundler
one_line_profile: Structure from Motion (SfM) toolkit for 3D reconstruction
detailed_description: Bundler is a structure-from-motion (SfM) system for unordered image collections, used to reconstruct 3D geometry and camera parameters from photographs.

name: spatstat
one_line_profile: Comprehensive R package for analyzing spatial point patterns
detailed_description: spatstat is a major R library for the statistical analysis of spatial point patterns, supporting a wide range of models, tests, and visualization methods.

name: spatstat.core
one_line_profile: Core functionality for data analysis and modelling in spatstat
detailed_description: spatstat.core contains the core statistical methods for the spatstat family, focusing on model fitting, simulation, and inference for spatial point processes.

name: spatstat.data
one_line_profile: Dataset component of the spatstat R package for spatial point pattern analysis
detailed_description: A sub-package of the spatstat ecosystem containing standard datasets used for demonstrating, testing, and benchmarking spatial statistical methods and point pattern analysis techniques.

name: spatstat.geom
one_line_profile: Core geometry definitions and operations for the spatstat package
detailed_description: A sub-package of spatstat that defines spatial data types (such as windows, pixel images, and point patterns) and provides fundamental geometrical operations for spatial analysis.

name: spatstat.linnet
one_line_profile: Extension for spatstat to handle point patterns on linear networks
detailed_description: A sub-package of spatstat specifically designed for defining and analyzing linear networks (such as road networks) and spatial point patterns occurring on them.

name: spatstat.model
one_line_profile: Parametric modeling and inference module for spatstat
detailed_description: A sub-package of spatstat containing functionality for fitting parametric models to spatial point pattern data, performing statistical inference, and model validation.

name: spatstat.random
one_line_profile: Random point pattern generation module for spatstat
detailed_description: A sub-package of spatstat providing functions for generating random spatial point patterns according to various stochastic models, essential for simulation and Monte Carlo tests.

name: spatstat.sphere
one_line_profile: Extension for spatstat to handle point patterns on the sphere
detailed_description: An extension package for spatstat that enables the analysis of point patterns on the surface of a sphere, useful for global-scale geospatial data.

name: spatstat.utils
one_line_profile: Utility functions for the spatstat ecosystem
detailed_description: A sub-package of spatstat containing low-level utility functions and helper methods used across the spatstat family of packages.

name: STK
one_line_profile: Small Toolbox for Kriging interpolation and regression in MATLAB
detailed_description: A MATLAB toolbox focused on Kriging interpolation and regression, closely related to Splines and Radial Basis Functions, interpreting them as non-parametric Bayesian methods using Gaussian Processes.

name: stpp
one_line_profile: R package for space-time point pattern simulation, visualisation and analysis
detailed_description: An R package providing tools for the analysis of space-time point patterns, including simulation of models, visualization of 3D patterns, and statistical testing.

name: TISSUE
one_line_profile: Uncertainty estimation tool for spatial transcriptomics gene expression predictions
detailed_description: TISSUE (Transcript Imputation with Spatial Single-cell Uncertainty Estimation) provides tools for estimating well-calibrated uncertainty measures for gene expression predictions in single-cell spatial transcriptomics datasets.

name: polire
one_line_profile: Python library for spatial interpolation methods
detailed_description: A Python library that provides a unified interface for various spatial interpolation techniques, including IDW, Kriging, and Splines, facilitating geospatial data analysis.

name: TheiaSfM
one_line_profile: Library for multiview geometry and structure from motion
detailed_description: An open-source C++ library for multiview geometry and structure from motion (SfM), providing efficient and accurate tools for 3D reconstruction from images.

name: INLAutils
one_line_profile: Utility functions for the R-INLA package for Bayesian spatial modeling
detailed_description: An R package providing helper functions and utilities to facilitate the use of R-INLA for fitting spatial and spatio-temporal models, including visualization and result processing.

name: SfMLearner
one_line_profile: Framework for unsupervised learning of depth and ego-motion from video
detailed_description: An unsupervised learning framework for estimating depth and ego-motion from monocular video sequences, widely used as a baseline in spatial structure learning and photogrammetry.

name: DISSTANS
one_line_profile: Toolbox for decomposition and inference of sources in spatiotemporal network signals
detailed_description: A Python toolbox for the Decomposition and Inference of Sources through Spatiotemporal Analysis of Network Signals, useful for analyzing propagation on networks.

name: giga-spatial
one_line_profile: Toolkit for scalable geospatial data processing and enrichment
detailed_description: A toolkit developed by UNICEF Giga for scalable geospatial data download, processing, and enrichment, supporting infrastructure mapping and accessibility analysis.

name: tidycensus
one_line_profile: R package to load US Census boundary and attribute data as tidyverse-ready data frames
detailed_description: An R package that allows users to interface with the US Census Bureau's API and return data in tidyverse-ready data frames, optionally including geometric data for spatial analysis.

name: H_Kriging
one_line_profile: MATLAB implementation of Hierarchical Kriging model
detailed_description: A MATLAB code implementation for the Hierarchical Kriging model, a variable fidelity surrogate model that serves as an improved version of co-Kriging for geostatistical analysis.

name: SpaDiT
one_line_profile: Diffusion Transformer for Spatial Gene Expression Prediction
detailed_description: A deep learning model based on Diffusion Transformers for predicting spatial gene expression from scRNA-seq data, bridging the gap between single-cell sequencing and spatial transcriptomics.

name: pyGeoStatistics
one_line_profile: Python library for geostatistical analysis
detailed_description: A Python library implementing various geostatistical methods, including variogram calculation and Kriging interpolation, designed for spatial data analysis.

name: policy-data-analyzer
one_line_profile: NLP framework for analyzing environmental policy incentives
detailed_description: An extensible framework using NLP and active learning to recognize incentives for landscape restoration in environmental policies, supporting scraping, preprocessing, and text analysis.

name: variogramfit
one_line_profile: MATLAB tool for fitting theoretical variograms
detailed_description: A MATLAB function to fit different theoretical variogram models to experimental variograms, a fundamental step in geostatistical modeling and Kriging.

name: jcontour
one_line_profile: Java library for meteorological contour plotting and interpolation
detailed_description: A Java-based tool for visualizing and analyzing meteorological data, integrating Inverse Distance Weighting (IDW) and Ordinary Kriging interpolation algorithms for contour generation.

name: V-FloodNet
one_line_profile: Video segmentation system for urban flood detection
detailed_description: A PyTorch implementation of a video segmentation system designed for detecting and quantifying urban floods, supporting environmental monitoring and disaster management.

name: GeoHD
one_line_profile: Toolkit for geospatial hotspot detection and analysis
detailed_description: A Python toolkit designed for geospatial hotspot detection, visualization, and analysis using urban data, aiding in spatial pattern recognition.

name: AQuA2
one_line_profile: Analysis tool for molecular spatiotemporal signals
detailed_description: A MATLAB-based tool for Activity Quantification and Analysis (AQuA) of molecular spatiotemporal signals, particularly useful in analyzing dynamic biological events.

name: Incremental_Kriging_Assisted_Evolutionary_Algorithm
one_line_profile: Kriging-assisted evolutionary algorithm for optimization
detailed_description: A MATLAB implementation of a fast Kriging-assisted evolutionary algorithm based on incremental learning, useful for computationally expensive optimization problems in engineering and science.

name: INCREASE
one_line_profile: Inductive Graph Representation Learning for Spatio-Temporal Kriging
detailed_description: A Python implementation of the INCREASE model, which uses inductive graph representation learning for spatio-temporal Kriging, enabling interpolation in spatial data.

name: DetectorFreeSfM
one_line_profile: Detector-Free Structure from Motion pipeline
detailed_description: A Python implementation of a detector-free Structure from Motion (SfM) pipeline, used for 3D reconstruction from 2D images, applicable in geosciences and photogrammetry.

name: HydroDesktop
one_line_profile: Open source GIS-enabled desktop application for hydrologic and climate data management
detailed_description: HydroDesktop is a free and open source GIS enabled desktop application that helps users search for, download, visualize, and analyze hydrologic and climate data registered with the CUAHSI Hydrologic Information System. It serves as a client for discovering and accessing water data services.

name: SMPL-Fitting
one_line_profile: Tool for fitting SMPL body models to 3D scans
detailed_description: A Python implementation for fitting the SMPL statistical body model to 3D scan data, commonly used in anthropometry, biomechanics, and computer vision research for analyzing human body shape and pose.

name: dash_doodler
one_line_profile: Interactive web tool for image segmentation
detailed_description: A web application built with Plotly Dash for semi-supervised image segmentation, designed for labeling scientific imagery such as geological or environmental scans with minimal supervision.

name: environmental-impact-tools
one_line_profile: Tools for environmental impact analysis
detailed_description: A set of Python tools developed by Esri for scientists and planners to analyze and report the potential impact of development projects on the natural environment.

name: FEMlium
one_line_profile: Visualization of FEM simulations on maps
detailed_description: A Python library that combines Finite Element Method (FEM) simulation results with Folium to create interactive geographic visualizations of physical simulations.

name: PyEarthScience
one_line_profile: Climate science data processing and visualization scripts
detailed_description: A collection of Python scripts and notebooks from DKRZ (German Climate Computing Center) for processing and visualizing climate science data, utilizing libraries like PyNGL, xarray, and Cartopy.

name: KnowFlow_AWM
one_line_profile: Open-source water quality monitoring system
detailed_description: An open-source hardware and software tool for automatic water monitoring, enabling the collection of water quality data for environmental research.

name: NCL
one_line_profile: Scripting language for the analysis and visualization of climate and weather data
detailed_description: The NCAR Command Language (NCL) is a scripting language specifically designed for the analysis and visualization of climate and weather data. It supports various scientific data formats like NetCDF, GRIB, and HDF, and provides high-quality graphics for scientific publications.

name: cf-view
one_line_profile: GUI for exploring and plotting netCDF and Met Office format data
detailed_description: A graphical user interface for exploring, analyzing, and plotting environmental data stored in netCDF and Met Office PP formats. Developed by the National Centre for Atmospheric Science (NCAS), it aids in the quick inspection of climate and meteorological datasets.

name: PAVICS-SDI
one_line_profile: Spatial Data Infrastructure for climate science analytics and visualization
detailed_description: PAVICS-SDI (Power Analytics and Visualization for Climate Science - Spatial Data Infrastructure) is a platform developed by Ouranos to provide infrastructure for climate data analysis and visualization. It integrates various OGC standards and tools to support climate science workflows.

name: Geo Data Viewer
one_line_profile: VSCode extension for visualizing geospatial data formats (GeoJSON, KML, etc.)
detailed_description: A Visual Studio Code extension that allows users to view and interact with geospatial data files directly within the editor using Kepler.gl, facilitating quick inspection and visualization of scientific map data.

name: bs4Dash
one_line_profile: Bootstrap 4 dashboard library for R Shiny applications
detailed_description: An R package that provides a Bootstrap 4 dashboard template for Shiny, enabling researchers and data scientists to build modern, responsive web-based dashboards for scientific data reporting and visualization.

name: shinyMobile
one_line_profile: Mobile-ready framework for R Shiny applications
detailed_description: An R package built on top of Framework7 that allows the creation of mobile-optimized Shiny apps, facilitating field data collection and mobile visualization of scientific data.

name: shinydashboardPlus
one_line_profile: Extensions for the shinydashboard R package
detailed_description: An extension package for 'shinydashboard' that adds more components and features (like improved sidebars, boxes, and widgets), enhancing the capabilities of R-based scientific dashboards.

name: ClimateSERV2
one_line_profile: Climate data visualization and download tool by SERVIR
detailed_description: A tool developed by SERVIR (NASA/USAID) that allows development practitioners and scientists to visualize and download historical rainfall, vegetation condition data, and forecasts to support decision-making in agriculture and water availability.

name: GPS Map Visualizer
one_line_profile: Tool to plot GPS coordinates from CSV on interactive maps
detailed_description: A Python-based tool designed to visualize GPS coordinate data from CSV files onto interactive maps with clustering capabilities, useful for visualizing field data or sensor locations.

name: Sensor Data Logger
one_line_profile: Android Wear app for logging and plotting sensor data
detailed_description: An application for Android Wear devices to log and visualize sensor data (accelerometer, gyroscope, etc.), useful for scientific data gathering and preliminary visualization in field studies.

name: golem
one_line_profile: Framework for building robust production-grade R Shiny apps
detailed_description: An opinionated framework for building production-grade Shiny applications, providing tools for structure, deployment, and module management, widely used for developing scientific dashboards and tools in R.

name: Monitor My Watershed
one_line_profile: Web application for sharing and visualizing environmental IoT data
detailed_description: A web platform enabling users to upload, share, and visualize environmental monitoring data (IoT sensors) based on the ODM2 data system, supporting watershed research and management.

name: AgroSphere
one_line_profile: Visualization of climate change effects on agriculture
detailed_description: A web application that visualizes global agriculture and weather station data to demonstrate the effects of climate change, serving as a tool for educational and research visualization.

name: environment.monitor
one_line_profile: Tool for continuous tracking of environmental components
detailed_description: A solution designed to provide a comprehensive interface for tracking and evaluating environmental health and component availability over time.

name: shinyjqui
one_line_profile: jQuery UI interactions for R Shiny applications
detailed_description: An R package that brings jQuery UI interactions (like drag-and-drop, resizing, and sorting) to Shiny apps, enhancing the interactivity of scientific dashboards.

name: localtileserver
one_line_profile: Dynamic tile server for visualizing geospatial rasters in Jupyter
detailed_description: A Python library that enables visualization of large geospatial raster datasets in Jupyter notebooks using ipyleaflet or folium. It acts as a bridge between raster data and interactive map visualizations, essential for environmental and geospatial analysis.

name: cccharts
one_line_profile: R package for visualizing climate change indicators and environmental data
detailed_description: An R package developed by the BC Government to create standardized, publication-ready data visualizations for climate change indicators. It provides functions to generate specific chart types used in environmental reporting.

name: rthreejs
one_line_profile: Three.js 3D visualization widgets for R and Shiny
detailed_description: An R package that provides an interface to the Three.js JavaScript library, enabling the creation of interactive 3D scatter plots, globes, and graph visualizations directly from R. It is widely used for scientific data visualization in R workflows.

name: prettymapp
one_line_profile: Webapp and Python tool to create maps from OpenStreetMap data
detailed_description: A Python tool and Streamlit webapp that allows users to generate aesthetic maps from OpenStreetMap data. It is useful for creating geospatial visualizations for reports and presentations.

name: streamlit-keplergl
one_line_profile: Streamlit component for rendering Kepler.gl maps
detailed_description: A Python library that integrates Kepler.gl, a powerful open-source geospatial analysis tool, into Streamlit applications. It enables researchers to build interactive dashboards for large-scale geospatial data visualization.

name: cloud-sustainability-dashboard
one_line_profile: Dashboard for optimizing cloud environmental sustainability
detailed_description: A dashboard tool designed to help organizations measure and visualize the carbon footprint and environmental impact of their cloud infrastructure usage, supporting sustainability reporting and optimization.

name: hockeystick
one_line_profile: R package to download and visualize global heating data
detailed_description: An R package that provides easy access to essential climate change datasets (e.g., CO2, global temperature) and functions to visualize them, facilitating climate data analysis and communication.

name: Dekart
one_line_profile: Backend for Kepler.gl enabling large-scale geospatial data visualization
detailed_description: Dekart is an open-source backend for Kepler.gl that allows for the visualization of large-scale geospatial datasets directly from databases like BigQuery and Athena. It is designed to handle heavy map visualizations that are critical in environmental monitoring and geographic information science (GIS).

name: mapa-streamlit
one_line_profile: Web application for creating 3D-printable models of earth surface from geospatial data
detailed_description: A Streamlit-based web application that utilizes the mapa library to generate 3D-printable STL models of the Earth's surface based on user-selected regions and topography data.

name: RAGxplorer
one_line_profile: Visualization tool for Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) systems
detailed_description: An open-source tool designed to visualize the document chunks and retrieval processes in RAG systems, helping researchers understand embedding spaces and retrieval quality.

name: geemap
one_line_profile: Interactive geospatial analysis and visualization with Google Earth Engine
detailed_description: A Python package for interactive mapping with Google Earth Engine, ipyleaflet, and ipywidgets, enabling users to analyze and visualize Earth observation data interactively in Jupyter environments.

name: eefolium
one_line_profile: Lightweight Python package for Earth Engine mapping with Folium
detailed_description: A lightweight Python library that integrates Google Earth Engine with Folium for interactive map visualization, serving as a simpler alternative to geemap for specific mapping tasks.

name: Panel
one_line_profile: High-level Python library for creating interactive scientific dashboards and web apps
detailed_description: Panel is an open-source Python library that lets you create custom interactive web apps and dashboards by connecting user-defined widgets to plots, images, tables, or text. It is part of the HoloViz ecosystem and is widely used in scientific computing to visualize data from libraries like Xarray, Pandas, and various plotting backends.

name: iSEE
one_line_profile: Interactive SummarizedExperiment Explorer for genomic data visualization
detailed_description: iSEE provides an interactive Shiny interface for exploring data stored in SummarizedExperiment objects. It is designed for bioinformatics applications, allowing researchers to visualize and analyze transcriptomics and other omics data without writing code.

name: teal
one_line_profile: Shiny-based framework for analyzing clinical trial data
detailed_description: teal is a framework for building interactive web applications for the analysis of clinical trial data. It provides a set of modules and tools to visualize and explore CDISC-compliant data, facilitating the reporting and analysis process in pharmaceutical research.

name: CO2-Gadget
one_line_profile: Advanced firmware for ESP32-based CO2 and environmental monitoring
detailed_description: A firmware solution for ESP32 microcontrollers that transforms them into advanced CO2 and environmental monitors. It supports real-time data visualization, logging, and various communication protocols (BLE, WIFI, MQTT) for environmental data collection.

name: ecological-inference
one_line_profile: Python library for ecological inference statistical methods
detailed_description: A Python implementation of ecological inference, a statistical process used to infer individual-level behavior from aggregate data. While named 'ecological', it is primarily a statistical method used in social sciences and demographics.

name: TagAnomaly
one_line_profile: Anomaly detection analysis tool for multiple time series
detailed_description: An R-based tool designed for anomaly detection analysis and labeling, specifically tailored for handling multiple time series data. It allows users to detect anomalies in categorical time series data, useful for environmental monitoring and sensor data analysis.

name: UrbanReflex
one_line_profile: Smart city platform for environmental monitoring and infrastructure management
detailed_description: An open-source smart city platform that integrates environmental monitoring, infrastructure status, and citizen reports. It transforms road segments into linked data nodes and uses AI for classification and prioritization of urban issues.

name: hexapod-robot-simulator
one_line_profile: First-principles hexapod robot simulator
detailed_description: A simulator for hexapod robots built from first principles, allowing for the study of kinematics, gait analysis, and robotic movement. Useful for robotics research and physics simulation.

name: canvasXpress
one_line_profile: JavaScript library for scientific data analytics and visualization
detailed_description: A standalone JavaScript library for data analytics and visualization, widely used in bioinformatics and genomics. It supports complex visualizations like heatmaps, boxplots, and network diagrams with full audit trail capabilities.

name: MONET
one_line_profile: Model and Observation Evaluation Toolkit for atmospheric composition
detailed_description: A toolkit developed by NOAA to evaluate atmospheric composition models (like CMAQ, CAMx) against observational data, facilitating verification and analysis of air quality models.

name: explainerdashboard
one_line_profile: Library to build interactive dashboards for explaining machine learning models
detailed_description: A Python library that allows users to quickly build interactive dashboards to explain the inner workings of machine learning models, including feature importance, shapley values, and individual predictions, useful for scientific model interpretation.

name: openairmaps
one_line_profile: Tools to create interactive maps of air pollution data
detailed_description: An R package designed to create interactive maps for air pollution data analysis, integrating with the openair ecosystem to visualize spatial distribution of pollutants.

name: streamlit-geospatial
one_line_profile: Multi-page Streamlit application for geospatial analysis
detailed_description: A comprehensive web application built with Streamlit that provides a suite of tools for geospatial analysis and visualization, allowing users to visualize vector/raster data without writing code.

name: Dash.jl
one_line_profile: Julia interface for the Dash analytical web application framework
detailed_description: The Julia interface to the Dash ecosystem, enabling the creation of analytical web applications and dashboards for scientific data visualization using Julia.

name: Dash
one_line_profile: Framework for building analytical web applications in Python
detailed_description: A productive Python framework for building web analytic applications, widely used in the scientific community for creating interactive dashboards and visualizing complex datasets.

name: Dash Cytoscape
one_line_profile: Component for interactive network visualization in Dash
detailed_description: A Dash component for creating interactive network visualizations, powered by Cytoscape.js, suitable for visualizing biological networks, ecological interactions, and other graph data.

name: Dash Deck
one_line_profile: Component for large-scale geospatial visualization in Dash
detailed_description: A library that integrates deck.gl and pydeck into Dash, enabling high-performance, large-scale geospatial data visualization for scientific applications.

name: Plastic Origins
one_line_profile: AI-powered river plastic pollution detection and mapping platform
detailed_description: A citizen science project and tool that uses artificial intelligence to detect and map plastic litter on river banks from video feeds, aiding in the monitoring of riverine pollution.

name: vayu
one_line_profile: Domain-specific visualization library for air quality data
detailed_description: A Python library designed specifically for creating high-quality, domain-standard visualizations for air quality monitoring, such as pollution roses and calendar plots.

name: topicwizard
one_line_profile: Interactive visualization library for interpreting topic models (LDA, NMF, BERTopic)
detailed_description: A Python library that provides an interactive interface for visualizing and interpreting topic models. It allows researchers to explore topic distributions, word relevance, and document-topic relationships, facilitating the analysis of textual data in social and environmental sciences.

name: ggedit
one_line_profile: Interactive editor for ggplot2 layer aesthetics and themes
detailed_description: An R package that provides an interactive GUI for editing ggplot2 plot aesthetics and theme definitions. It helps researchers fine-tune scientific visualizations without manually adjusting complex code parameters.

name: Terra
one_line_profile: Multimodal spatio-temporal dataset and benchmark spanning the Earth
detailed_description: Terra is a multimodal spatio-temporal dataset and benchmark designed for Earth system modeling. It integrates various data sources to support research in environmental monitoring and climate science.

name: Oil-Spill-Detection-SAR
one_line_profile: Deep learning workflow for oil spill detection using synthetic SAR data
detailed_description: A project demonstrating oil spill detection in synthetic SAR imagery. It includes tools for generating synthetic datasets with speckle noise and spill regions, and a U-Net model for segmentation.

name: Wetland-Classification-GEE-CNN
one_line_profile: Wetland classification workflow using synthetic spectral features
detailed_description: Employs synthetic spectral and index features to classify land into water, wetland, and upland. Demonstrates a workflow combining remote sensing concepts with deep learning.

name: aq-biascorrection
one_line_profile: Bias correction tool for CAMS air quality model predictions
detailed_description: A tool for bias correction of air quality CAMS model predictions by using OpenAQ observations. Developed by ECMWF Code for Earth.

name: eo4ai
one_line_profile: Earth Observation dataset preprocessing tools for Deep Learning
detailed_description: A set of tools for preprocessing Earth Observation datasets to make them suitable for Deep Learning applications, developed by ESA Phi-Lab.

name: Dataset4EO
one_line_profile: Platform and library for Earth Observation datasets
detailed_description: Official repository for the EarthNets Platform, providing access and tools for various Earth Observation datasets.

name: RSI-Classification
one_line_profile: Remote Sensing Image Classification tools
detailed_description: Tools and models for Image/Scene Classification in Remote Sensing Images, part of the EarthNets Platform.

name: RSI-Detection
one_line_profile: Remote Sensing Object Detection tools
detailed_description: Tools and models for Object Detection in Remote Sensing Images, part of the EarthNets Platform.

name: RSI-Segmentation
one_line_profile: Remote Sensing Semantic Segmentation tools
detailed_description: Tools and models for Semantic Segmentation in Remote Sensing Images, part of the EarthNets Platform.

name: TFNet-ESC
one_line_profile: Time-Frequency Network for Environmental Sound Classification
detailed_description: A deep learning method (TFNet) for environmental sound classification that uses temporal and frequency attention mechanisms to enhance features from audio signals.

name: SustainDC
one_line_profile: Data Center simulation and control environment
detailed_description: A set of Python environments for Data Center simulation and control using Heterogeneous Multi Agent Reinforcement Learning, focusing on sustainability and energy optimization.

name: SustainCluster
one_line_profile: Benchmark environment for sustainable workload scheduling
detailed_description: A high-fidelity Gymnasium environment for benchmarking multi-objective, sustainable workload scheduling across geo-distributed data centers, integrating energy, carbon, and weather data.

name: Sustain-LC
one_line_profile: Benchmarking environment for data center controls
detailed_description: A benchmarking environment for traditional, reinforcement learning, and LLM-based controls in data centers, focusing on sustainability.

name: IUCNN
one_line_profile: Neural networks for predicting species conservation status
detailed_description: A tool to train neural networks based on geographic species occurrences, environmental data, and IUCN Red List assessments to predict the conservation status of species.

name: WBLCA Benchmark V2 Data
one_line_profile: Dataset for Whole Building Life Cycle Assessment (WBLCA) benchmarking
detailed_description: A public repository containing data collected and prepared for the CLF WBLCA Benchmark Study V2. It includes building design characteristics, life cycle inventories, and environmental impact assessment results for 292 building projects in North America.

name: PredBench
one_line_profile: Benchmark suite for spatio-temporal prediction across diverse disciplines
detailed_description: A comprehensive benchmark for evaluating spatio-temporal prediction models across various scientific disciplines, including weather forecasting and environmental monitoring. It provides standardized datasets and metrics for comparing model performance.

name: GeoBenchX
one_line_profile: Benchmark for LLM agents on multi-step geospatial tasks
detailed_description: A benchmark suite designed to evaluate Large Language Model (LLM) agents on complex, multi-step geospatial tasks. It includes an LLM-as-Judge evaluation framework to assess tool usage and reasoning in geospatial contexts.

name: Weather Data Analytics Framework
one_line_profile: Framework for frequency-based analysis of extreme climate events
detailed_description: A MATLAB-based framework for modeling and benchmarking occurrences of extreme climate events, such as extreme temperature and precipitation. It employs empirical cumulative distribution functions (ECDF) for learning and prediction phases.

name: SDGi Corpus Benchmarks
one_line_profile: Benchmarks for text classification by Sustainable Development Goals
detailed_description: A multilingual dataset and benchmark suite for classifying text according to the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). Developed by UNDP, it supports policy science and environmental text analysis.

name: CY-Bench
one_line_profile: Benchmark for subnational crop yield forecasting
detailed_description: A comprehensive dataset and benchmark for forecasting crop yields at the subnational level. It standardizes the selection, processing, and spatio-temporal harmonization of public yield statistics with relevant predictors for agricultural modeling.

name: mbDenoise
one_line_profile: Microbiome data denoising using zero-inflated probabilistic PCA
detailed_description: An accurate and robust method for denoising microbiome count matrices. It uses a zero-inflated probabilistic PCA (ZIPPCA) model to handle zero-inflation, unequal sequencing depth, and overdispersion in microbiome data, recovering true abundance levels.

name: TetWild
one_line_profile: Robust tetrahedral meshing for simulation
detailed_description: A robust tool for generating tetrahedral meshes from arbitrary triangle soups. While general-purpose, it is a critical solver for scientific simulations (finite element analysis) in physics and engineering contexts.

name: SentinelDataDownloaderTool
one_line_profile: Automated Sentinel satellite data downloader for AI datasets
detailed_description: A set of scripts utilizing the Google Earth Engine Python API to automate the creation of datasets from Sentinel satellite imagery, facilitating the preparation of Earth Observation data for AI applications.

name: py-openaq
one_line_profile: Python wrapper for accessing OpenAQ air quality data
detailed_description: A Python library that provides a wrapper for the OpenAQ API, facilitating the retrieval and integration of global air quality data for environmental research.

name: EarthNet Minicuber
one_line_profile: Tool for creating EarthNet minicubes for vegetation forecasting
detailed_description: Official utility tool for the EarthNet challenge to create and process 'minicubes' (spatio-temporal data cubes) used in geospatial vegetation forecasting benchmarks.

name: EarthNet Models PyTorch
one_line_profile: Deep learning models for EarthNet vegetation forecasting benchmark
detailed_description: A collection of PyTorch implementations of deep neural networks specifically designed for the EarthNet geospatial vegetation forecasting challenge.

name: StationBench
one_line_profile: Benchmarking weather forecasts against station observations
detailed_description: A Python library for benchmarking weather forecast models specifically against ground station observations, providing tools for data alignment and metric computation.

name: airPy
one_line_profile: Tool for generating AI-ready air quality datasets from Earth Engine
detailed_description: A Python package to generate AI-ready datasets for air quality and Earth Observation studies by interfacing with Google Earth Engine.

name: WILDS
one_line_profile: Benchmark of in-the-wild distribution shifts for machine learning
detailed_description: A benchmark package for evaluating machine learning models on distribution shifts, including datasets and metrics for environmental and ecological tasks (e.g., iWildCam for animal monitoring, PovertyMap for satellite imagery analysis).

name: WEATHER-5K
one_line_profile: Large-scale benchmark for global station weather forecasting
detailed_description: A benchmark suite and dataset for next-generation global station weather forecasting, including time-series data and evaluation protocols.
